official_title: A bill to provide for a study by the Secretary of Transportation, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of the Treasury, concerning measures necessary to ensure the security of firearms, ammunition, and explosions being transported in interstate commerce.

summary.text: Arms Transportation Security Act of 1983 - Directs the Secretary of Transportation to study: (1) the prevalent causes of losses of firearms, ammunition, and explosives (including components) being transported in interstate commerce by private persons or government agencies; (2) the standards of security necessary to provide adequate protection from losses of such items; and (3) the appropriate measures necessary to achieve such standards. Directs the Secretary to report to the President and Congress within one year on the results of such study.
